options.A: A. A type of learning where the model learns from labeled data.
options.B: B. A type of learning where the model learns from unlabeled data.
options.C: C. A type of learning where the model learns from reinforcement.
options.D: D. A type of learning where the model learns from semi-labeled data.

question: 2. Which of the following is an example of supervised learning algorithm?

options.A: A. A generic version of a decision tree algorithm.

question: 4. How is the best attribute chosen in the ID3 algorithm?

options.A: A. The attribute with the maximum information gain.
options.B: B. The attribute with the minimum information gain.
options.C: C. The attribute with the maximum entropy.
options.D: D. The attribute with the minimum entropy.

question: 5. What is entropy in the context of decision trees?

options.A: A. A measure of randomness or uncertainty.
options.B: B. A measure of information gain.
options.C: C. A measure of the average number of bits required to encode the labels.
options.D: D. A measure of the average number of splits in the tree.
